items.title: Trump says US 'will run' Venezuela after strikes
items.description: Deposed Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro is now in New York after he was "captured" in an early-morning US raid on the nation. Follow live.

items.title: Venezuelans across the globe divided over US mission to capture Maduro
items.description: Venezuelan migrants across Latin America and other parts of the world cheered in the streets, supporting the US mission to capture Venezuela's deposed president Nicolás Maduro.

items.title: Venezuelans living in Australia watch events in home country
items.description: Australia's small but tight-knit community of Venezuelan-born residents is gathering to discuss the unfolding situation in their home country after the US captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.

items.title: Live: Bad light stops play at SCG with storm clouds looming and England on top
items.description: The top two men's Test batters in the world, Joe Root and Harry Brook, reach half-centuries on day one of the final Ashes Test at the SCG. Follow live.

items.title: 'I could have been where they are': Aussie teen loses friend in Swiss bar fire
items.description: Yaron Lavy, from Melbourne, says he had planned to join friends at the Le Constellation bar on New Year's Eve but stopped to get water — a decision that may have saved his life.

items.title: America's 250th birthday party will serve up a toxic brew of exceptionalism
items.description: It is entirely fitting that the US is so splintered on its semiquincentennial. Division, for the lion's share of its history, has been its default.

items.title: US makes 'bold' grab for oil as markets brace for Monday
items.description: Oil futures do not trade until Monday, Australian time, and financial market participants are divided over whether there will be a spike or correction in the price of oil in Asian trade.

items.title: Australian brands still dealing with 'the wild west' of Trump's tariffs
items.description: From de minimis to beef tariffs, Aussie exporters are preparing for another "wild" year.

items.title: Hindus 'living in fear' after man's public lynching for alleged blasphemy
items.description: Four Hindu men have been killed in Muslim-majority Bangladesh in just over two weeks, and several houses have been burned, leaving the minority community traumatised and fearing for their lives.

items.title: 'National crisis': Sports stars call for Bondi federal royal commission
items.description: Ian Thorpe, Jess Fox and Lleyton Hewitt are among more than 60 Australian sports stars joining public calls for a Commonwealth royal commission into the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Amid a population crisis, this island needs migrants to keep its industry alive
items.description: The Japanese island of Etajima's oyster industry relies almost entirely on foreign workers due to its aging population.

items.title: Tourists stranded, dozens of roads closed as rain continues in outback Queensland
items.description: Tourists are stranded in towns dotted across north-west Queensland as rain continues to keep major rivers in flood.

items.title: How you're already relying on AI, even if you think you're not
items.description: Artificial intelligence is a controversial subject, but as the debate rages it is already being used by ACT government departments, doctors and the people running firefighting operations.

items.title: Experts weigh in on the butter versus margarine debate
items.description: You might have a personal preference for which spread you use at home, but experts say there are health considerations for which one you use.

items.title: 'I went ahead alone': Pakistani woman climbed K2 while pregnant
items.description: Pakistani women are hiking some of the world's tallest mountains and glacier trails, claiming a space that has long been out of reach.

items.title: Two drownings in two days along NSW South Coast as man dies at Jervis Bay
items.description: A 20-year-old man speaks of rescuing three people from rough water on his paddleboard, including a 34-year-old man who was declared dead after he was brought onto the beach.

items.title: Friends keep teenage pact to retire in the outback together
items.description: Veronica and Wendy made a pact as teenagers to move back to their hometown to retire together. More than 40 years later they have kept their promise.

items.title: The daunting prospect of playing Evonne Goolagong Cawley on screen
items.description: Lila McGuire on the pressure and joy of playing former world number one and winner of seven grand slam singles titles, tennis legend Evonne Goolagong Cawley.

items.title: Top End dams overflow as parks come to life in the wake of Cyclone Fina
items.description: The Northern Territory's Top End has been transformed into a lush green paradise by a cyclone and a monsoon that have brought an unusually heavy start to the annual wet season.

items.title: Major fire at grain storage facility north of Shepparton
items.description: Fire crews put out a fire that was described as having the potential to cause an explosion early this morning.

items.title: Man told to pay $120,000 over unauthorised backyard cheese business
items.description: An Adelaide retiree who continually ignored orders to remove an unauthorised backyard cheesemaking facility from his suburban home is ordered to pay more than $120,000 in costs, after being found guilty of contempt of court.

items.title: A station and infamous murders: What happened to Sydney's Macdonaldtown?
items.description: It's the suburb in Sydney that no longer exists — except for a train station — but did it disappear because of scandalous murders or was it just to increase property prices?

items.title: England 18yo Littler wins back-to-back world darts titles
items.description: Luke Littler underlines his status as a generational talent in darts with a comfortable victory in the final of the World Darts Championship in London.

items.title: Worker dies in Central Queensland mine following roof collapse
items.description: A worker has died after a roof collapse at the Curragh mining complex in Central Queensland.

items.title: Charity offering pet owners in need vet care, emergency boarding and food
items.description: A new charity is helping low socio-economic households keep their pets, by offering emergency boarding and funding for veterinary care.
